dialogues.text: On the morrow I'll be awake enough to see if dreams come true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pray they don't turn out to be nightmares. Jack ponders this morbid thought as he and is companions stare silently into the dwindling fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dying embers of the campfire CARRY OVER and BLEND int the blood-red blaze of the rising sun.  Swathed in mist and fog, the day star gleams dully, like the glowing eye of some half-mad creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faerie warriors prepare for battle.  Moving like ghosts in the mist, they gather weapons and carefully hon their swords and spear-tips. SOUNDS of HAMMERING and CHOPPING, as the elves and goblin work at building ladders and siege equipment. A pair of faeries fits together a catapult, the parts of which were painfully transported all this distance. Jack and Gump stand on a small rise overseeing the activity.  As the sun's warmth dispels the mist, the massive walls of Castle Couer de Noir materialize before them.

dialogues.speaker: CASTLE
dialogues.text: Shreds of mist are stripped away by the wind, like dead flesh peeling from a corpse, as the true nature of Castle Couer de Noir is revealed for the first time.  The massiv walls of the deformed fortress are constructed not of blocks of stone but with human bones.  Like the catacombs of Paris, the skulls and bones, millions and millions of them, are arranged in geometric and decorative patterns, stacked one upon the other, an ossuary reaching to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battlements of Hell...

dialogues.speaker: GUMP AND JACK
dialogues.text: The Green Man and the faerie stare in mute horror at the walls of the castle.  The monstrosity of the evil dwarfs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tells you something 'bout him what lives there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need more siege machinery and longer scaling ladders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not mine the damned walls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do both.  Our frontal attack a diversion whilst we drive a tunnel under... Gump is cheered by Jack's decisiveness and the boldness o his plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll set the dwarves to digging. Gump hurries off down the hill, muttering and chuckling t himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together unto the breach... storming the bastions of darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His black cloak whipping in the wind, masked and gloved, the unicorn horn mounted as a sword and strapped at his side, the Baron stands gazing down from his tower at the frenzied faerie activity below.  At his side are two FISH HEADED DEMONS, made more hideous by the deformed armor they wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An army of mites... see them scurry...

dialogues.speaker: THE FAERIES
dialogues.text: From the height of the tower, the faeries indeed seem to be mites, frenzied in their tiny activity.  A battery of catapults is aligned, scaling ladders laid out in even rows.  Gump barks orders as the faerie soldiers form ranks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even a wolf has fleas...

dialogues.speaker: BARON AND DEMONS
dialogues.text: The Baron leans against the parapet, the armored demons a his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why so few?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delusion... a kind of magic which works against the magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fool's magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely.  Faith has persuaded them a pygmie with a sling can kill an armed giant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb magic.  Giant smash peewee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go out, smash 'em now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Smashing is not required.  I have a surprise for our tiny invaders... Raise that hatch! The Baron points to an iron grill covering a skylight. The demons scuttle over and lift it off.  Immediately, th DRONE of thousands of tiny wings is HEARD within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love surprises. The DRONING grows LOUDER and LOUDER until a dark swarm of fanged frog/bats rushes from the keep like a dark whirlwind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdies... pretty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt the faeries will admire their beauty... Come, this will be fun to watch. The demons lurch back to the parapet, peering over with the Baron as the black cloud of SCREAMING frog/bats descends like an angry tempest on the faeries gathered below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FANFARE of trumpets as the faerie soldiers form ranks o the plain before Castle Couer de Noir.  Rows of catapults siege towers and scaling ladders are arranged along the edge of the icy forest.  Gump strides up and down in his armor before the assembling troops, barking orders like a sergeant-major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step lively now...!  Pick up the pace, lads... This is war, not baby- pinching or curdling milk... Splendid in his armor, Jack rides the unicorn in review a the faerie soldiers stand in proud formation before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Gump.  A braver-looking host I can't imagine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men, I'm not much on pretty speeches.  In a short while, the heat of battle will test us all, and I know that each of you will prove true and -- Jack is interrupted by the DRONE of thousands of wings growing EVER-LOUDER.  A shadow falls across the assembled soldiers.  Jack looks up to see the cause.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
dialogues.text: Like a tornado of utter evil, the dark storm cloud of frog/bats swirls down from the castle tower, their high, falsetto SCREECHING rising above the DRONE of wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What calamity be this?

dialogues.speaker: THE FAERIE TROOP
dialogues.text: The cloud of fluttering frog/bats envelops the ranks of faerie soldiers.  Fluttering, screaming, the tiny winged creatures swarm into the ranks biting and scratching.  Th faeries strike futilely at them with swords and spears. It is like fighting gnats with a teaspoon.  There is no way to keep order.  In a moment, it's every man for himself.  The formation is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwball has a frog/bat attached to his face, the tiny teeth ripping.  He tears at the creature and falls to the ground, rolling over and over and SCREAMING in pain. A frog/bat zooms down on Gump.  SEEN C.U., the gaping frog-mouth with its row of needle-sharp teeth is genuinel terrifying. Gump is already having problems with a half-dozen clingin frog/bats.  They bite and tear through his clothing as he swats at them. The entire formation of faerie soldiers is in disarray. They mill about in frantic confusion, helplessly fighting the swirling myriads of frog/bats surrounding them. In his armor, Jack is relatively well-protected from the infuriating creatures.  Sword in hand, he hacks flying frog/bats from the the air as skillfully as a tennis player returning a serve.  Several of the evil winged creatures land on the unicorn's rump, biting and drawing blood.  Sapphire rears and whinnies in fear and pain. Jack swats them off with his free hand, doing his best to soothe his mount at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy girl... easy now, Sapphire... calm yourself, they're no worse than horse-flies in summer... (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men!  Defend yourselves...!  Form a shield wall... hurry!  Form a shield wall!

dialogues.speaker: THE FAERIE TROOP
dialogues.text: Struggling in panic against the aerial onslaught of the frog/bats, the faerie soldiers take heart from Jack's command.  They rally with encouraging cries of:  "Come on lads, hop to it."  "Get your shields up."  And "All together now, form the wall." The savage flying cloud continues its torment as the beleaguered faeries muster together and form a large shield wall.  The troops in the center lift their shields above their heads, forming an armored ceiling against the dive-bombing frog/bats.  The outer perimeters are also ranked with over-lapping shields.  The entire phalanx closes itself in behind a solid wall of iron shields. Jack and Gump, among the last to join the formation, hurr to its protection as the fury of the frog/bats swirls about them.  Jack jumps down from the unicorn and pulls his mount with him under the protection of the shield wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack urges Sapphire to kneel among the troops.  He wipes the blood from her flanks and calms her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down girl... kneel, my darling... it's all right now... you're safe in here. A steady, gong-like CLANGING resounds under the shield wall.  It is the SOUND of hundreds and hundreds of frog/bats diving into the uplifted shields. Gump, his clothing torn and face bloodied, crawls over to Jack between the stalwart shield-holders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine mess this is... horrid, nipping creatures... What do we now, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defend ourselves.  We've bested far worse already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easily spoken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't loose heart... Assemble the archers.  Have everyone not holding a shield man a bow.  Shoot the damned things as they fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't enough arrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  Just do it!  Retrieve the arrows somehow. Gump thinks it's helpless but nevertheless musters up a determined expression and begins barking commands in his most military manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go then, lads.  You heard Jack.  Every man with a bow, front and center... Aim up through the shields.  Send these damn gad-flies to hell... The archers scramble into position, kneeling between the shield holders and aiming up through the intervening spaces at the frog/bat tempest fluttering above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron and the demons watch the frenzied commotion below.  The Baron enjoys the spectacle immensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight's over before it's begun... soon the survivors will be in full retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we smash 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything left for smashing you may happily smash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch... good fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, the best of fun... Enjoy yourselves. The Baron wraps his cloak about him and starts for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go?  Not watch fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something far more pleasant awaiting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More fun win battle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is another victory, my friends. What began with the lash shall be concluded with a caress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to lady now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To finish last evening's delightful work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come watch... we come watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay.  This is a private affair, no audience welcome... Better you watch the dismantling of our enemies... and, look you, see the moat is set aflame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire moat... why do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purely a precaution... The Demons bow low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you command, sire... The Baron stalks off, sweeping down the circular stairs into the keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passage is dark and windowless, lighted by occasional flaming torches.  The Baron strides the length of the hall.  He strips off his protective black garments, casting them aside in his impatient lust.  First, the heavy gloves, then the wolf-mask, last, with a flourish, the floor-length midnight cloak. Stripped to a simple under-gown, the Baron pauses before thick iron-bound door.  He is panting now, his nostrils dilated, flecks of spittle frothing his whiskers.  His eyes narrow as he flings open the unbolted door and steps forward into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the shield wall is a world of shadows, the shield bearers dark and solid as tree trunks; the archers moving between them like silhouettes of Sagittarius.  Beams of light stab down through the openings.  The archers kneel, aim and fire upwards into the light.  The DRUMMING of dive-bombing frog/bats rumbles like thunder. The archers encourage one another with boasts and compliments.  "Good shot."  "Right between the eyes!" "Bullseye!"  etc. etc. Screwball kneels and fires next to Jack and Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady... steady... (he fires)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  Straight on... straight... (his eyes widen with delight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody marvelous shot! Something CLANGS on the shields above.  Screwball's arrow drops at his feet.  Three frog/bats are impaled upon the shaft like shishkabob. Screwball grabs up the arrow and waves his trophy in fron of Jack and Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that shot!  Three at once! I can't miss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very thrifty.  Even got your arrow back. All at once, a bright BLAZE of orange LIGHT brightens the interior of the shield wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet slippers of Oisin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've fired the moat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water doesn't burn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And frog don't fly and bite like tomcats.  It be magic, Jack... powerful ogre's magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't much time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been telling you that all along, lad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What magic have we on our side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faerie magic's no match for a sorcerer's power... We have Ogg's gifts, the key and the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!  The unbreakable line! We'll tie it to an arrow and fire it up into the timbers above the portculis... then, I'll climb up and chop down the drawbridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you chance a miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some way to get it up there. Gump eyes Screwball, aiming through the shield-wall, and sly smile spreads across his elfin features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Jack, methinks I have the perfect solution...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of bright flames surrounds the macabre walls of th Baron's castle, the black smoke blending with the swirlin cloud of frog/bats.  Cowering beneath all this fury, the faeries' shield wall seems a meager fortress at best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very dark.  A small fire on the hearth provides the only light, casting bold, flickering shadows across the spartan chamber. Something moves in the shadows.  Something sleek and swift.  There is another movement, sensual and predatory; a hunting animal. The shadows dance; animal forms glide through the flickering light.  They are not hunting, but mating. Their fur shines in the firelight.  Tails SWISH in erotic sinuosity.  The low, growling MOAN of their love language is the SOUND of pure, primal pleasure. Glimpsed through the shadows, the sensuous sliding animal movement of the Baron and Lili becomes a passionate ballet.  Their dark bodies writhe and merge, a collision of clouds -- the mating of shadows. Lili is no victim here, but a willing and eager participant.  She seems utterly feminine and feline, her back arched, a vibrant MOAN purring from her throat. The Baron mounts her, proud as a stallion, and their rhythmic coupling casts lyric shadows across the bare stone walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drifting smoke swirls over the uplifted shields as Jack, Gump and Screwball break from the cover and protection of the phalanx.  They sprint across the open plain.  The smoke covers them.  Their escape goes unnoticed by the furious frog/bats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the crest of the hill where the plain meets the wooded forest, the faeries' siege machinery stands in martial ranks facing Castle Couer de Noir.  A row of catapults is front and foremost.  Jack and Gump run up the hill toward the engines of war.  Screwball lags behind, complaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me, that's all I ask...?  Why not Gunner or Floki...?  Someone who doesn't bruise so easy... Screwball reluctantly joins the others at the first of th catapults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone like Floki... or Squarefoot... or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full with authority)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do it because I am you liege and I command you to do it! Screwball gulps back a complaint and kneels before Gump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye... my Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise, Screwball, and into the basket with you. Screwball gets slowly to his feet, and just as slowly climbs into the launching basket of the catapult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's a better idea... What about birds... get a lift from some friendly bird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't heard a bird sing in days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a kite...!  We could make a kite... Let the wind do the work --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Screwball is instantly silent.  Gump hands him the dwarves' golden rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start acting like you're worthy of this mission... Here.  Whatever you do, don't dare drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay, Sire, I'll cling to it as to life itself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, lad... Here, Jack, give me a hand with the windlass... There's a good fellow... Together, Jack and Gump labor at winding back the windlas on the catapult.  As they turn, the launching arm is draw slowly back, a cowering Screwball fearfully clutching the golden line in the woven-leather basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! The launching arm is bent back into a taut arch. Screwball clenches his eyes shut.  Jack stands by the release lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the engineers corrected for alignment and trajectory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye.  Before the wee pesties attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's Godspeed, Screwball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon's hump protect me-eeeeeeee! Jack pulls the lever releasing the windlass and the arm whips forward, catapulting Screwball high into the air over the castle.  His cry is lost on the wind as his form diminishes into a tiny dot arcing over the walls above th flaming moat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lean-to roofed with thatch is build along the inside wall, sheltering a stable.  The courtyard is deserted as Screwball comes hurtling like a meteor.  He lands in the thatch and sinks from sight. After a moment, Screwball's pixie face appears out of the straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone what doesn't bruise, says I... glorious mission, says they... A CLATTER of armored FOOTFALLS alerts Screwball to the approach of the Baron's demonic troops.  A squad of hideous Heironymous Bosch imps, fearful combinations of reptiles and swine, long-beaked birds with insect wings, feathered rodents, deformed jackals, trots NOISILY across the cobbles below. Screwball ducks into the thatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear... oh, dear... straight from Hell by the looks of 'em... The grotesque armor the imps wear adds to their sinister appearance.  They JABBER LOUDLY at one-another in a fearful GOBBLEDYGOOK.  The wicked points of their partisans glitter, passing at eye-level as Screwball burrows deeper into the thatch. After a moment, the echoes of the imps passage fades. Screwball pops up out of the straw and has a look around, the coiled golden line clutched tightly in his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet they eat elves for breakfast... Screwball clambers to the top of the lean-to roof and climbs up the protruding bones and skulls to the top of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwball stares down the dizzying abyss into the flaming moat.  He waves at his beleaguered companions, but is hidden from view by drifting smoke.  This is a good thing for another squad of imp-goons troops across the courtyar below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get moving, Screwball, 'fore they serves you up on a piece of toast! Screwball scampers along the ridge of the wall, hopping over the crenelations like a squirrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall abuts into the curving battlements of the central keep, towering above.  A narrow ledge leads away from the top of the wall, arcing around the keep to the portculis. Screwball begins the traverse like a mountaineer, edging one sliding foot at a time along the ledge, trying not to look down into the flame and smoke, nor across at his comrades huddles under the shield wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Gump wait by the catapult, straining to see through the smoke shrouding the facade of the ghastly castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is... out on the keep!

dialogues.speaker: THE CASTLE
dialogues.text: At the distance, Screwball seems quite helpless, inching along the outer wall of the keep like a mouse on the back of a sleeping lion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: as he stares, hawklike, at Screwball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be atop the portculis ere long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best get down close to the moat, lad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye.  We're good as inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what we'll find there worries me. Using the drifting smoke for cover, Jack runs down the open hillside towards the flaming moat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwball continues his cautious progress across the curving facade of the keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be out sippin' fresh cow's milk straight from the udder... that's what I should be doing... Screwball's progress takes him under a sealed iron shutter.  The SOUND of GROWLS and MOANING brings him up short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this now? Hooking his fingers into the eye-sockets of a convenient skull, Screwball gets a good grip and clambers up the wal to the window sill.  Hanging like a bat, he peers through the tiny slit between the bottom of the shutter and the sill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS of MOANING are LOW and VIBRANT.  The room is masked in shadows.  Items of torn, discarded clothing lie in contorted positions about the flagstone floor.  The coals on the hearth glow like the eyes of a demonic beast Not far away, the unicorn horn leans against the wall, bathed in the ember's glow.  Lili and the Baron lie together amidst a tangle of quilts and featherbeds.  They MOAN softly, bodies wrapped in sinuous ease.  Their dark fur gleams.  Very tenderly, they lick one-another, like cats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwball carefully lowers himself back to the ledge, grinning like a pixie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found the alicorn, I did, I did... Found the Baron, too... hee, hee... Screwball tip-toes away on the ledge, more sure of himsel now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be the first caught on love's horns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A copper-sheathed arch rising over the entranceway.  The drawbridge is drawn-up tight underneath and serves as a massive gate. Screwball hops off the ledge onto the roof.  A gargoyle rivaling the Baron's impish cohorts juts out of the wall just beneath.  Screwball ties one end of the golden line around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hurries along the moat-edge, flames licking past him He looks up and spots Screwball tying the line to the gargoyle above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwball, down here! Screwball waves at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done like a champion.  Can you reach me with the line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwball ties his sheath-knife to the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy as eating pancakes. Screwball tosses the weighted line out over the moat.  It clears the flames and lands at Jack's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack jumps with the line and pendulums across the moat through the leaping flames.  He lands with his feet against the bones of the wall and proceeds to haul himsel up, hand over hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack reaches the top of the drawbridge.  He walks the rop like a man on a leash and gets a leg over the top.  On a small platform under the open roof stands a large wooden winch.  The thick cable securing the drawbridge is wound around it. Jack climbs onto the platform and draws his sword.  In three swift strokes he hacks through the cable.  The winc spins wildly as the chain holding the drawbridge rattle out through embrasures. Amid the clatter, the drawbridge slowly descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drawbridge gathers speed and lands with a LOUD CRASH across the flaming moat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batting away bombarding frog/bats, Gump rushes up to the shield wall, shouting for joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lads... Look...!  The drawbridge is down... The walls be breached... The faeries under their shields give out with a single, exultant victory CHEER, breaking ranks and running pell- mell down the hill towards the lowered drawbridge.  The frog/bats fly after them like a swarm of pursuing bees. High above the portculis, Jack waves his sword in the air cheering them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOUTING and YELLING like invading Vikings, the faerie soldiers swarm across the drawbridge, swords and spears o high.  They are met by an alarmed contingent of the Baron's household guard.  A nightmare battle is joined, faeries against fiends.  The CLASH of steel on steel RING through the stone courtyard.  Sapphire gallops into the thick of the fray, impaling a mole-faced imp on her long, spiraling horn. The frog/bats, swarming in under the open portculis, make no distinction between friend and for, biting and harassing the Baron's troops as indiscriminately as the faerie soldiers.  This adds an additional element of confusion to the conflict.  The faeries gain ground, hacking and stabbing into the inner reaches of the castle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR and HOWL of battle drowns Jack's enthusiastic CHEERS as he urges his men on from atop the roof over the portculis. We SEE Screwball eagerly telling what he observed in the keep, but the SOUNDS of the conflict below COVER his actual words.  It is obvious from Screwball's enthusiasti gestures that he describes the location of the unicorn horn.  Screwball points along the ledge to the shuttered window in the keep. A tremendous CRY OF VICTORY rises from below as the faeries break through the ranks of imps and surge forward into the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark.  Lili lies in the Baron's arms surrounded by tangled bedclothing.  He strokes her soft fur gently.  A muffled CRY is HEARD outside and Lili, alarmed, sits up abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?  Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing.  My men take great delight in routing the enemy.  Don't trouble yourself, beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded like it came from the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the parapets most likely.  The men are amused by a battlefield entertainment of my own contriving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might we watch, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, beloved... Now I wish only to be with you... Lili snuggles against the Baron's chest, running her fingers through the silky hair covering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I with you... I never dreamed life held such pleasures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure is for those who seize it! Do you think those insipid, pale- skinned mortals will ever know such rapture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's odd... when I first found myself... changing... I was sick with loathing and disgust.  I thought I was so ugly I wanted to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I want to live forever.  I've never felt so strong or happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or looked so beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I feel that, too.  Weakness is what is ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely, my darling.  Your animal strength, your primitive power has surfaced... you are what you desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be strong and free... that is all I desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you shall be... Like our brothers, the hawk and the wolf, our spirits know no master... we are created in the pure image of the savage God that set our turbulent universe in motion. Lili stretches languidly, rubbing against the Baron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what savagery would please you most, my Lord? The Baron's talons rake Lili's fur as he hauls her into a rough embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mating with you, beloved... to share that exquisite pain once more. The Baron bites her shoulder.  Lili YIPS with animal delight. The iron shutters are thrown open with a loud CRASH.  A swath of sunlight stabs into the darkened chamber.  Sword in hand, Jack stands on the window sill, silhouetted against the brightness outside. The Baron SHRIEKS and falls off the bed, GROANING with pain on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light...!  The light...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yield, Couer de Noir, or I grant no quarter! The Baron scrambles on all fours across the floor, seekin to avoid the light.  He snatches up the unicorn horn leaning against the wall and ducks into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protect me, beloved...!  I need your help!

dialogues.speaker: LILI
dialogues.text: as she reacts to the Baron's plight.  Her eyes narrow; he ears tuck back; a low GROWL rumbles from her throat as sh bears her fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defend me...!  My darling, you must defend me! With the ROAR of a savage jungle cat, Lili leaps down off the bed as Jack jumps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid to fight, Baron? Claws hooked and gleaming, Lili stalks GROWLING between Jack and the cowering Baron.  Jack doesn't recognize her, so monstrous in her savage appearance.  He backs away a step, holding his sword in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any closer and I'll cut you down. Lili GROWLS.  With a sudden leap, she is upon Jack, rakin his face with her claws as she sinks her fangs into his neck where the bare flesh shows above his breastplate. Jack SCREAMS in surprise and pain, falling back under Lili's attack. Jack and Lili fall to the floor, rolling over and over in a fierce struggle. In the shadows, the Baron takes advantage of this distraction.  He creeps to the side of the fireplace and pulls a hidden switch.  A secret panel swings away from the wall.  Quickly, the Baron scurries inside the dark passageway beyond.  The panel slides closed behind him. Jack pulls free from the wild creature assaulting him.  H struggles to his feet, grabbing up his sword where he dropped it in the attack. Lili crouches, SNARLING as Jack backs away.  With a wild CRY, she springs at him again.  Jack thrusts defensively with his sword.  Lili is impaled, the gleaming blade run completely through her body.  MOANING, she sags into Jack's arms, his golden armor drenched in her blood.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND LILI
dialogues.text: as she trembles in Jack's unwilling embrace, Lili's features alter and transform.  The fangs and claws disappear.  Her fur is gone.  She is just a naked girl again, dying in her lover's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lili!  No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack... Forgive me... As gently as possible, Jack pulls the sword from Lili's body.  He drops the weapon to the floor and lifts the gravely injured Princess in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only what's right... Jack carries Lili over to the bed and lays her gently down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead... I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was bewitched... it's better this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me you were dead. Lili is weakening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I were... will be soon... Don't be troubled, Jack, tis a great gift you've given me... Jack buries his face in the bed-clothes, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I won't let it happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've freed me, Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Baron's damnable work!  Too cowardly to stand and fight... he used you to save himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... it's not you he's afraid of, it's... light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight... It destroys him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why he goes masked during the day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he's hiding in the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark... where I join him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Don't let go... you mustn't!  I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I... love you... The door to the bedroom crashes open and Gump, along with Screwball and several other armed faeries, enter excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack!  The courtyard's been taken... The Baron's forces are besieged in the south tower.  No sign of... Jack?  Do you hear what I'm saying? We've won, lad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense!  Course it matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the Princess Lili... I've killed her. Gump approaches the bed and examines the wounded Princess

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sore hurt, Jack, tis true, but not dead yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wound is mortal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay.  You've not reckoned with the powers of faerie medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you save her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easily... The question is, can we save ourselves?  Be a shame to win the battle only to lose the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alicorn, lad.  Come to your senses!  Unless we find Baron Couer de Noir and bring back the horn the world is doomed. Jack is himself again, eager for action.  He grabs up his fallen sword and starts for the sealed secret passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Baron hides in the dark in a passage under the Castle... Quick, give me the dwarf's key... the one which opens any lock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark, lad?  Why should he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because sunlight will kill him. Quickly now, give me the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight, you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye.  Hurry now, Gump, the key!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mean you to seek him out below?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admire your valor, Jack.  By all means, seek him out... But first, we needs visit the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stout shelves along the masonry walls are rows and row of brightly polished plates and pots.  All sizes and shapes; gold, silver and copper kitchen utensils shine an sparkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND GUMP
dialogues.text: They stand by the huge hearth, staring up at the cookware shining all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen be the most important room in a palace, for if the victuals ain't right, little else is likely to be so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring me here to sup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay, lad, we're here to collect a weapon you'll need fighting the Baron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What weapon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plan on carrying some away in a kettle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easier than that, Jack. (to Screwball)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screwball!  Fetch me down a couple of them plates. Screwball scurries up to a nearby shelf and brings down two large golden plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll do nicely. Gump takes a plate and polishes it on his sleeve.  He points to the far side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand over there and hold your plate... like this. Gump demonstrates how he wants the plate held.  Screwball grips it with both hands, holding it up before Jack like mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you explain what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience, lad. Gump moves to where a beam of sunlight angles through the high kitchen window.  He holds his plate in the light, trying different angles, until at last he manages to reflect the sunlight, beaming it straight at the plate Screwball holds.  Instantly, it is reflected off Screwball's plate and strikes Jack straight in the eye, blinding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Stop it!  I can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but you will.  And so will the Baron, when we bring a little light to his dark hideaway. Gump aims his platter at Jack.  A BLAZE of reflected sunlight FILLS THE SCREEN with dazzling whiteness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice, Goldenrod. A very young elf struggles to hold a giant golden salver, sending a beam of sunlight scintillating down the meandering tunnel. Gump and Jack hold torches at the next bend.  Gump positions a lovely niade with a copper pot lid, stealing kiss on her fair shoulder in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand here, my dear... that's right... Gump stands behind the niade, guiding her arms so that th pot lid catches the sun-beam properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it just a wee bit... The beam bounces on down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: zig-zags up through the interior of the castle, steep stone stairs leading from level to level.  Faeries stand at every bend, passing the sunlight one to another like a astral bucket brigade.  Standing in a long soup-kitchen line in the darkness alongside, is a file of elves, faeries and gnomes, each holding a platter, bowl or pot lid.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND GUMP
dialogues.text: Drawn sword in hand, torch up-lifted, Jack stands at the head of the procession, impatiently stepping forward into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we move any faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tis a delicate operation, lad. Requires a bit of engineering... Next! A hunched, long-bearded GNOME hurries forward, clutching copper frying pan polished to a mirror-finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown Tom o' Kirkdale reporting for duty, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand easy, Brown Tom... Right here is good...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Jack moves quite a good way down the tunnel, a corona of torchlight surrounding him in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems to be some sort of vaulted chamber up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get too far!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torch in hand, Jack moves cautiously out of the passagewa into a vast underground room spacious as the nave of a cathedral.  Stone columns thick as tree-trunks rise into the shadows above.  Jack never relaxes his guard.  He turns to check behind him every third step. From a distance, Jack shines like a multi-faceted jewel. His every surface winks with reflected light: breastplate, shield, helmet, even the long, tapered sword held before him. Gump's voice ECHOES from FAR AWAY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ja-ack... Jack is mid-way into the chamber.  He moves like a canny warrior, pivoting, checking his rear, light on his toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sibilant HISS of a sword-blade rending the air.  The CLANG of contact as the torch is knocked from Jack's gras and sent tumbling to the floor. Jack whirls to face the challenge.  It is the Baron. Enormous in the flickering light of the fallen torch, lik some horned bear on his hind legs, the Baron advances, th unicorn horn gripped in his sword hand. Jack hauls his shield off his back, stepping forward to meet the challenge.  The Baron swings with both hands gripping the horn hilt.  Jack parries with the "Avatar." When steel hits the alicorn it is as if lightning strikes Sparks fly.  A second exchange has Jack in retreat. The Baron lunges with the alicorn.  Jack receives the thrust on his shield.  The curling point of the horn punctures the dwarf's handiwork like an arrow through a target.  For a moment, the two combatants are locked together, face-to-face.  Secure in his armor, Jack swings his sword at the unclad Baron.  He leaps back with the agility of a wild beast, wrenching the shield from Jack's grip and flinging it clattering aside into darkness. Jack backs away as the Baron renews the attack.  Again, the lightning CLASH of swordplay.  Jack strives valiantly to withstand the onslaught but the Baron is too powerful. The swordplay comes faster.  Jack stumbles to one knee. The Baron disarms him with a mighty blow.  The "Avatar" RINGS musically as it tumbles out of reach into the shadows. The Baron's leering face is made more demonic by the unsteady torchlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, boy... Pray while there's still breath in you... The Baron draws back his arm for the death stroke.  The torch flickers out. The Baron's CRY RESOUNDS in the BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blinding FLASH of LIGHT.  The Baron SCREAMS, a wail of utter pain as the beam of sunlight hits him.

dialogues.speaker: SCREWBALL
dialogues.text: stands by a pillar holding a silver plate.  He directs th sunlight at the Baron, following him as he twists and writhes in agony.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: scrambles across the floor, seizing his fallen sword.  He leaps to his feet and rushes at the cringing Baron, caugh in the light like a hapless moth. It is Jack's turn to wield a death-blow.  He draws back t strike and the LIGHT WOBBLES.  The BEAM STRIKES Jack in the eyes.  He is momentarily blinded.  He swings and misses, his sword carving the empty air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: GUMP
dialogues.text: rushes up to Screwball, cuffing him sharply on the back o the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. The CLATTER of HOOF-FALLS is HEARD galloping in the distance. Jack rushes up, sword in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting away!  He was at my mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never show mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have struck off his head just now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done... we'll never catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever wondered why Jenny Greenteeth said you needed the fastest steed on earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sapphire! Gump turns brusquely to Screwball, grabbing his tunic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fetch the unicorn... pass it along... Screwball runs up the vast chamber to an elf standing at the entrance to the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fetch the unicorn... pass it along... The elf turns abruptly and runs up the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From elf to dwarf to goblin the word is passed.  The wee folk scurry like moles in the dark tunnel, their PIPING VOICES taking up the cry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... fetch the unicorn... pass it along... fetch the unicorn... pass it along... fetch the unicorn... pass it along... The tiny VOICES MERGE and BLEND as the message is transmitted more and more rapidly.  The words are lost in the steady rhythm.  It is like the CHIRPING of crickets o a summer evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHIRPING VOICES CARRY OVER and become the CLIP-CLOP o hooves.  A graceful elf leads Sapphire, the mare unicorn, out of the darkness to where Gump, Screwball and several other faeries stand waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swift as thistledown on the wind, that's the faerie way... Jack has recovered his shield, now slung across his back. He vaults effortlessly aboard the unicorn, clutching the long mane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Sapphire... Gump hands him up a blazing torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ride like wild fire, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll not escape me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on your own... like a true champion. Jack stabs his heels into the unicorn's flank and is lost from sight as a single leap carries him into darkness. Gump and the others stand watching as the SOUND of hoof- clatter FADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... champion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack gallops out of the vaulted chamber through a tall portal leading into a winding cave.  Torch held high, Jac races between the tapered spines of stalagmites.  The shadows of the stalactites, hanging like daggers, shift o the stone walls as the unicorn thunders past. Up ahead, a distant gleam of natural light beckons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Sapphire burst from the mouth of the cave in a spray of dust.  Jack wheels the mare around to a halt as he studies the barren ground.  A distinct set of hoof- prints leads off into the distance.  Jack urges Sapphire into a gallop along this track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a landscape of Death, like some Breughel vision of Hell.  Ravaged by war and pestilence, all of the trees ar stripped bare.  The houses are in ruins, broken walls and tumbled towers stand like rotten stumps.  Bones protrude from the muck.  Corpses lie bloated and moldering. Wagon wheels are set atop naked trees, skeletons tied spread-eagled across them.  Like hooded inquisitors, vultures perch hunched along the rims. Villages smolder in ruins in the distance.  Smoke drifts like fog between the blasted trees.  Resolutely, Jack keeps up the chase.  The unicorn flies like a specter across the moribund landscape.  Jack is riding towards th very gates of Hell itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landscape is barren now even of destruction.  Mud volcanoes belch steam and fire.  Grotesque buttes hunch under an unforgiving sky. A wall of sulfurous flames leap like a vast curtain behind the sudden precipice cleaving abruptly from the edge of the earth. The Baron stands alone like a Titan at the edge of this cliff, his mount dead at his feet.  His silhouette is terrible against the flames.  He holds the alicorn like Zeus gripping a thunderbolt. Jack trots forward on Sapphire to meet him.  At twenty paces distance, he dismounts and draws his sword. The Baron smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Jack... I knew you'd be along. Holding his shield before him, Jack closes on the Baron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Jack, are you not...?  The Princess has told me so much about you... Jack grimaces at the mention of Lili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cursed her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave her a taste of such joy as her wildest dreams never provided... even now my seed takes hold in the fiery furnace of her womb. Jack rushes at him in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie! Jack swings wildly.  The Baron parries with the alicorn. Sparks FLASH on contact.  Jack is driven back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foolish boy!  I take what I want and so I took your Princess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you! Jack leaps to the attack but the Baron holds him back, SPARKS FLYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... exactly... damnation!  Don't you know me, Jack?  Don't you know from whence I come? The Baron's form alters hideously.  Huge leathery wings sprout behind him.  His eye glow like coals.  Talons form on his hairy hands.  Lizard scales armor his chest.  He truly appears to be a demon from Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bring your head as a gift to my Lord Lucifer. Alicorn gripped in both hands, the Baron rushes forward. He swings with all his might.  Jack parries with the "Avatar."  There is an EXPLOSION of LIGHT.  Jack's sword is broken in two.  The force of the blow knocks him to hi knees.  He is helpless. The Baron raises the alicorn to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, oh my master, Satan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Baron stands, sword/horn uplifted like a sacrificial priest, the storm-darkened heavens suddenly part.  The clouds open and a ray of sunlight strikes the Baron like a bolt from God. The Baron contorts with pain in the bright light.  The unicorn horn glows white-hot.  The fur on his hand smokes and he drops the alicorn, SCREAMING with pain. Without warning, Sapphire gallops up behind the Baron and spears him through the middle.  The unicorn lifts his writhing form high in the air, impaled like some kicking insect.  With a toss of her horn, she hurls him to the ground. The Baron hunches on his knees, gripping his mid-section in a futile attempt to keep the foul black bile from spilling out of him like a discharge of sewer water.  He rears back his fanged head and SHOUTS in pain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Satan... protect me!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: jumps to his feet.  In three swift strides he has snatched-up the alicorn.  It is no longer incandescent with heat. Without pausing, Jack delivers a round-house swing, lopping the Baron's head from his shoulders.  A fountain of black filth spews from his truncated neck as the body topples. The severed head bounces off the edge of the cliff, tumbling out of sight past circling buzzards into the haz of smoke. Jack looks over and grins at Sapphire, who rears and whinnies in triumph. The Baron's body sags like a deliquescent pumpkin, leakin rottenness.  Smoke swirls around the cliff edge.  Jack wipes the alicorn clean of the Baron's black blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead, Lili... he can't hurt you any more... The Baron's body continues to melt away, seeping into the dry dust like bubbling tar. Sapphire sidles over and rubs against Jack.  The Green Ma wraps his arm around the unicorn's neck.  The two companions stand at the edge of earth, staring out into the swirling flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world is lush and green once again.  The trees billow like deciduous cumuli.  Bold spring flowers polka-dot the emerald meadow.  In the distance, the Castle Couer de Noi is in flames, thick, black smoke staining the azure sky. The faerie army marches across the meadow, singing jubilantly.  They carry their wounded away on litters. Foremost of these are the biers bearing Oona and Lili. The Princess' litter is festooned with blossom; heaps of wild-flowers blanket the unconscious girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sky is high, the world is wide, Beneath the flowers faeries hide... Mounted on Sapphire and her foal, Jack and Gump pause on the crest of the hill to look back on the faerie procession and the burning castle.  Jack carries the alicorn like a marshall's baton.  The SOUND of the faeries' SINGING drifts musically up across the meadow. Jimmy Squarefoot staggers along under an armload of booty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good day for singing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've not heard a note out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the mood, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to him.  Not in the mood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a day like none other the blessed earth has ever seen... A day so fair as forty springtimes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not denying it's a joyous day --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your joy if you cannot sing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were the Princess Lili to join me I would sing till my lungs burst!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives... isn't that worth singing about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lives like all the world before the Baron's curse lifted.  Now the world's reborn, yet still she sleeps... Across the way, the castle Couer de Noir collapses in upo itself in a spasm of sparks and fire.  Only the outer walls and the keep remain.  Cracks appear as the final ramparts begin to crumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too impatient... See how long the castle burns.  Think you evil be purged in an instant...?  And remember:  the quest is not concluded. Jack runs his hands along the spiraling length of the alicorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye... We'll fetch it back, praise God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skull of the slain unicorn has been reunited with his horn.  A band of silver filigree conceals the repair-work Bedecked with flowers, the skull rests on a velvet pillow It is being carried in a procession.

dialogues.speaker: FUNERAL PROCESSION
dialogues.text: There is nothing somber or sorrowful about the ceremony. Screwball, dressed in flowers, carries the pillow bearing the unicorn's skull.  Behind him, beautiful winged faerie maidens in gossamer gowns carry long, serpentine festoons of flowers.  Other elves and goblins toss handfuls of petals and pollen into the air.  They all sing happily as Sapphire and her colt prance along with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees are green, spirits unseen, The world we know is but a dream. The flowers sing; all birds take wing, Life and Death are an endless ring. The procession approaches an underground faerie tomb, beautifully constructed of fieldstone.  The opening is like a well, leading down to the beehive chamber beneath the earth.  At the bottom, on a blanket of blossoms, the unicorn's bleached alabaster bones are precisely arranged Two winged faeries take the pillow from Screwball and fly with it down into the tomb, placing it at the head of the skeleton.  A shaft of sunlight makes the skull and horn gleam like polished ivory.  All the elves and faeries, laughing and singing, cast the flowers they carry down into the tomb.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND GUMP
dialogues.text: With the happy SOUND of the funeral as a counterpoint, neither Jack nor Gump appear particularly overjoyed.  The stand beside Princess Lili's litter.  Her still, pale for and the surrounding profusion of flowers bear too close a resemblance to the ceremony in the BACKGROUND.  Jack and Gump mourn the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quest's at an end and where's the good of it?  A faerie festival over a pile of bones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tis not the wound, that's sure.  Not a scar remains... we're talking about a spell; harder to repair than sword-work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do anything... face any challenge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might not need a gesture quite so grand.  What were you doing the very moment the Baron's curse fell on the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was with the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the pond.  She was teasing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on... go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tossed her ring in the pond and bid me fetch it.  Said she'd marry me if I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay.  It was lost.  When I came up for air the pond was frozen over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it then... the ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As beautiful and serene as when first we SAW it.  The Princess is laid out under a tree, cushioned by thousands of flowers.  All the faeries stand about the edge of the water watching Jack remove his armor. Jack unbuckles the golden breastplate of Achilles and stacks it next to his gleaming shield and helmet.  Gump helps him unfasten the greaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must find the ring... It completes the cycle; answers the riddle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good at riddles... Find the ring and the spell is broken. Jack stripes down completely.  He steps to the edge of th pond, pausing for a moment to look fondly at his faerie friends gathered around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fond wishes give me strength, dear friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hooting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No speeches!  What's a little swim after sticking worms and ogres? The faeries applaud and CHEER.  Blushing, Jack dives into the water.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The cheering is silenced by the rush of water as Jack streaks down, streams of air-bubbles in his wake. Jack strokes deeper and deeper, past undulating weeds and curious fish. At the bottom, he moves carefully, trying not to stir up the muck.  He gently parts the drifting tendrils, searching among the weeds. A winking gleam catches his eye.  He reaches out an eager hand to seize whatever it is. A cloud of silt issues from his grasp as he opens his fingers.  Centered on his palm, golden and perfect, is th ring. Jack turns and strokes for the surface, a shining ceiling of light far above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack breaks the still surface with a happy SHOUT.  He holds the ring triumphantly above his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exultant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it!  I found it! LAUGHING joyously, Jack swims for the shore.  The banks are deserted.  Not a single faerie remains.  But Jack seems not to notice.  He takes hold of a tree-root and hauls himself back on land.  The golden armor of Achilles is gone.  In its place are Jack's old fur and leaf vestments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And will my lady honor her word in exchange for this bauble? Jack stops short when he sees the Princess asleep under the tree.  There is no trace of the heaps of flowers upon which she rested.  Nor of the jeweled gown she wore on th litter.  She looks just as before.  Only asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I see what an exciting spectacle I've provided... Tossing the ring abstractly up and down, Jack pulls on hi fur trousers and approaches the sleeping Princess.  He kneels before her, lifting her hand to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beggars on horseback come courting the crown... Jack slips the ring on Lili's finger.  Her eye-lashes flutter.  She is awake, looking him straight in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  Green Jack!  What a dream I've had... proper nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whilst you were sleeping, I fetched your ring. Lili looks at her ring and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jack.  I'm so sorry you found me asleep.  Don't know what came over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't have been under much more than a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemed like weeks and weeks.  Such a terrible dream... I could never tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is what you said about the ring but another dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, dearest Jack... I meant every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're teasing still. Lili wraps her arms around his neck, kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay, dearest Jack... you are to be my husband.  I want none other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... I am a Green Man.  I have no title, nor lands... scarce even a few vines and threads to keep the cold from my body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wear your weeds as well as golden armor, Jack.  Like a true Prince... a champion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lili... I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you, my husband. They fall eagerly into each other's arms.  Their long, passionate embrace is interrupted by an unseen pest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Jack swats at his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch!  Something's biting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinching me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinching?  Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere!  Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor can I.  Damn!  It's buzzing all around me.  Ouch!  I can hear it like a fly trapped inside my ear... Says its name is Oona!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oona?  Do you suppose it's a faerie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!  Whatever it is, it hurts. Princess Lili takes Jack by the hand and starts running, pulling him along with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up then, Jack o' the Green... You'll be safe in the castle... We'll hand out bells and crosses... strew the floors with flax and salt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lili and Jack run together holding hands down a sunlit forest path.  The DIALOGUE is CONTINUOUS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No faeries in the palace... We have our own magician, knows lots of spells... First, we'll tell my father the news... you'll like my father, Jack.  He's not like most kings... Watching from a high bank, unseen by Lili and Jack, the mare unicorn and her black colt stand in sun-dappled silence.  The colt rubs against his mother's flank as she gently blows on his mane with her delicate sea-shell nostrils. Below, Jack and Lili run together up the path into a BLAZ of sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and we won't have to stay in some stuffy manor all the time. When the weather's fair we can live in the woods... I'll wear homespun like shepherdess... They disappear into the GLARE and the screen goes WHITE.
